page.title: 18John Ford and Co. Ltd.
page.content: Altogether{48 people}are employed at the factory, which started in the High Street in{1920}and moved to Reedieden in{1960.}The wool used in knitwear and hosiery is{Australian.}It may be blended with synthetic yarn and some{ {Falkland Islands}wool has been used. There are many stages in making a jersey.{Cuffs}and{ribs}are machine knitted and transferred stitch by stitch to frames, ready for the{bodies and{sleeves}to be knitted by another machine.{Collars}and{neckribs}are linked on by hand.{Seams}have to be stitched,{garments checked,}and{flaws} {repaired.}The{bands}etc are finished off{by hand}and the garment is{pressed and{packed. Hosiery} is made on smaller circular machines and again hand finished. In a week{200 dozen {hose}and{62 dozen jerseys}are produced and sold in{U.K., U.S.A.}and{France.
